events.title: Battle of the Little Bighorn
events.description: Lieutenant Colonel George Armstrong Custer and his troops were defeated by Lakota, Northern Cheyenne, and Arapaho warriors in Montana Territory.
events.significance: This battle marked a major victory for Native American tribes during the Great Sioux War and had a lasting impact on U.S. policy towards Native Americans.

events.title: Start of the Korean War
events.description: North Korean forces crossed the 38th parallel and invaded South Korea, initiating the Korean War.
events.significance: The conflict drew in multiple countries, including the U.S. and China, leading to a prolonged Cold War-era military engagement.

events.title: Croatia and Slovenia Declare Independence from Yugoslavia
events.description: Both republics officially declared their independence, prompting armed conflicts that marked the beginning of the breakup of Yugoslavia.
events.significance: These declarations triggered the Yugoslav Wars and the eventual dissolution of Yugoslavia into several independent nations.

events.title: Grover Cleveland Becomes the Only U.S. President to Serve Two Non-Consecutive Terms
events.description: Grover Cleveland started his second term as the 24th President of the United States.
events.significance: His unique position highlights an exceptional political career in American presidential history.
